title: Grades 9-10
subject: Extended Content Standards For English Language Arts (2017-)

document.title: North Carolina EXTENDED CONTENT STANDARDS English Language Arts K-12

ADA723BCA14346E5AB912E9AC0F9C35A.description: Use general academic and domain-specific words and phrases across contexts.

D294479B97564AFB83EC5F6C037CE3B7.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.6 – Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for
reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in developing vocabulary
knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.

2BD043C0FD064064B12F3584AE023534.description: Determine the intended meaning of multiple meaning words.

3F332A793196422084FB7CD340A096B3.description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and use.

959DE84A972943D088B482A93E826E12.description: CCR Anchor Standard L.5 – Demonstrate understanding of figurative language and nuances in word meanings.

48D38C8896ED484DA876BEF13EE87855.description: Demonstrate knowledge of unknown and multiple-meaning words drawn from grade 9-10 content using context clues.

02F50D4DDFF64D919EC2AD9BD948A997.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.4 – Determine and clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context
clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

176D4EBA0E6344008EF473F274E2EEF2.description: Use language and vary syntax when writing and communicating to achieve desired outcomes.

2718B4C453FE402E9222454EB89FB040.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.3 – Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective
choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully reading or listening.

F64C3C0BD32B4717A6D55AD905EE9B99.description: Demonstrate understanding of conventions of standard English within 9-12 conventions continuum when writing.

111884BCD18D4BC18CCFBBD7705F3727.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.2 – Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when
writing; demonstrate proficiency within the appropriate grade band conventions continuum.

B778D23DCB5C48C6BEFAEA3AAB306055.description: Demonstrate standard English grammar and usage within the 9-12 grammar continuum when writing or communicating.

1E28AF12757E4586B833049D96065584.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.1 – Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking;
demonstrate proficiency within the appropriate grade band grammar continuum.

8A9C66CE733F400F80B89EAC08ED5FAA.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.6 – Determine whether information presented in diverse media (book, newspaper, video, television, internet) is
credible and identify discrepancies.

C761FA82E9AB4925BF23B55B00B03B25.description: Use digital media in presentations to support understanding.

13476C65C61F47F9969CCDF646AEF97B.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.5 – Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance
understanding of presentations.

5EC7B9A80A6448538CCF0FADE13BC4BA.description: Communicate findings including relevant descriptions, facts or details with an organization that supports purpose, audience, and task.

75A52A6915DF4D8BA05D9BD645A4F848.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.4 – Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning
and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

AF1FBAC8A6914F8A945829E412641FFF.description: Determine the speaker’s point of view on a topic.

BD0CFDF3092649189A43A6D2307A97D1.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.3 – Determine whether information presented in diverse media (book, newspaper, video, television, internet) is
credible and identify discrepancies.

B815BD4861DB4773957A79EAD0353380.description: Determine the credibility of information presented in diverse media or formats.

920151CD738F445C9CDD7B3E339217AC.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.2 – Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively,
and orally.

1AC149F6D4CD48D69F828CD48A097730.description: Indicate agreement or disagreement with others during discussions.

4F82710D9538462B8BFCC9ACB57ED44B.description: Relate the topic of discussion to broader themes or ideas.

EDD019E22A7D4B3CAB55098C273DB380.description: Work with adults and peers to set rules for discussions.

5CB70D838C98409AA76B9E2DE2C34D06.description: Prepare for discussions by collecting information on the topic.

67343E0FD9974F49B6AC7AD42557370F.description: Communicate with others in group interactions.

5EF9387288CB4BE0B73818D5DAF22763.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.1 – Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners,
building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

A40A742C02F943BD96B3E7F58BE15A9C.description: Integrated into Standards W.1, W.2, and W.3

F9E2B4C6F1254997923BE9DA8CFCD51E.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.10 (in 2010 Standards) – 2010: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and
revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

92992A14B0794D70AFE6941665FD3698.description: Omitted because it is an expectation of RL and RI Standards

839B175D1F364F128D75BF0F9E930311.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.9 (in 2010 Standards) – 2010: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection,
and research. Proposed: Omitted because it is an expectation of RL and RI Standards

F7616D7DEE7048AF8F7ED0D06F4F1A70.description: Write answers to research questions by selecting relevant information from multiple resources.

CBA7B022D3224C438C94D9A08D71F6E6.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.6 (from Proposed Standards – was W.8 in 2010 Standards) – Gather relevant information from multiple print and
digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

462F43050A1E421BBA41F7A32793A8E9.description: Conduct research projects to answer questions posed by self and others using multiple sources of information.

62A26CA544E1445DA5E43AA315B942F1.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.5 (from Proposed Standards – was W.7 in 2010 Standards) – Conduct short as well as more sustained research
projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

036CA4F416C243C0B0EA1663514689CD.description: Use digital tools to produce, publish, and update individual or shared writing products.

023E563488D4479289714F5E21E4D56C.description: CR Anchor Standard W.4: Use digital tools and resources to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

835B12E29FEE4A59B0ADF19F0EBA10A7.description: Use descriptive words and phrases to convey a vivid picture of experiences, events, setting, or characters.

C947636A23EE43CBA833FEF34B4D643C.description: Organize the events in the narrative using temporal words to signal order as appropriate.

5BAA5D554C32439DB47DA605CAE7F800.description: Write a narrative about a problem, situation, or observation including at least one character, details, and clearly sequenced events.

1163878D2C014955B7C5109BE387B4D7.description: Write about events or personal experiences.

D4EA111A019E4B8D867F5D17B6A65593.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.3 – Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen
details, and well-structured event sequences.

435E122F43644A9283ADEE7807C27C2D.description: Providing a closing or concluding statement.

E525200A41BA462A9082940F8F01F893.description: Use domain specific vocabulary when writing claims related to a topic of study or text.

6B8B430DEBAE416F99D0ABE039A12EF7.description: Use complete, simple sentences as appropriate.

AEAAB41501F841CCB8A5D0D9FCB9A970.description: Develop the topic with facts or details.

8B473D528A4A40BB8B077CCA7ABEC485.description: Introduce a topic clearly and use a clear organization to write about it including visual, tactual, or multimedia information as appropriate.

3EC5A2CE21BB4BF0BCEDE3DE1CFF39E2.description: Write to share information supported by details.

4A99CB352F27434E87BDDE68756DC8BB.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.2 – Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and
accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

F79CF6DD3D0848C6BBD521D53A871083.description: Introduce a topic or text and write one claim and one counterclaim about it.

3F1313273BD2472EBAB6F7BC52C7F679.description: Write claims about topics or texts.

BF687CED2E554AE29994B26909513099.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.1 – Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and
relevant and sufficient evidence.

8C9894EEE5234C5BA72AF89E08030213.description:
Actively engage in reading of information text for sustained periods of time for the purpose of connecting prior knowledge and experiences
to text.

F8B9CFA996B3438496EACBF960EB749D.description:
CR Anchor Standard RI.10: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently, connecting prior
knowledge and experiences to text.

48AB02D2D2D94E6986D037181E7E87B6.description: Make connections between texts with related themes and concepts.

5B054B869B0A4320A2D94C263AD9574F.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.9 – Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare
the approaches the authors take.

26A1C86D5B8B426DA79EB26A8B1906D8.description: Analyze the argument or specific claims in a text and determine what evidence is provided to support them.

071B9420722A434DBC1085B374F68612.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.8 – Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as
well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

1A8F1AC0BBDD42EEB52EC56DC0B9EDDF.description: Analyze two accounts of a subject told in different mediums to compare and contrast them.

7EFE61AAAA6C44D89686015543629146.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.7 – Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively,
as well as in words.

04466A2DC13149FD89970156FC7DA7F2.description: Determine author’s point of view and compare with own point of view.

924AD24A53D04D85985B0671DEF1BF4B.description: CCR Anchor Standard RI.6: Assess how point of view, perspective, or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

850525A6DA994838AD2C47B425D44983.description: Locate sentences that support an author’s central idea or claim.

CC06C8409B6646BF811B7391119056D6.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.5 – Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text
(e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

DE14072C1BF048349BA97B6489844C3C.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in text; analyze word choices and the impact on meaning.

5F97F5351B66466E95C1112A944A16D5.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.4: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning
or tone.

C86AC05373EC403EB08CA1609592311E.description: Determine connections between individuals, ideas, or events in a text.

356D881080E348C8A96DEC191D326791.description: CCR Anchor Standard RI.3 – Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

A12F7474DBAD40F3AA6710505032BE41.description: Determine the central idea of the text and select details that relate to it; recount the text

99E56D153952430AA3E19701E00B31A7.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.2 – Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting
details and ideas.

2AED9196FAE7407B9972EAB3B71E2DDE.description: Determine which citations demonstrate what the text says explicitly as well as inferentially.

F68CF1D36BD648F194C704750BE2EA7A.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.1 – Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific
textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.

81F5CCAD777F49A28BC8B18811D51D72.description: Actively engage in reading for the purpose of connecting prior knowledge and experiences to text for sustained periods of time."

AED9A0BE80D1445894A61FA078FD8687.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.10: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently, connecting
prior knowledge and experiences to text.

74A69FC4C835493AAE37A4D06A566821.description: Identify when an author draws upon or references a different text.

4E5DCACFD9B44CDAA47D9B18646D6F44.description:
CCRAnchorStandardRL.9 – Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the
approaches the authors take.

C926631962A746F88B50481879D41023.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.8 – Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as
well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

A61B5E980489490AAE326599FF2D77C6.description: Compare the representation of a subject or topic in two different artistic mediums.

05AF02B785524DC885982807E9837A76.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.7 – Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively,
as well as in words.

FFA6DDDDEB5D470083654073D8DF8655.description:
Determine a point of view or cultural experience in a work of literature from outside the United States and compare it with own point of view
or experience.

740FFDD77C3C42519E5306E1C09B50C3.description: CCR Anchor Standard RL.6 Assess how point of view, perspective, or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

7A444D7401344AC6B1B584D8BEA7D7D9.description: Order events in a story that appear in a chronological order.

38069D389361484DA1CD5D6B3727143C.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.5 – Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text
(e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

2490F6BF287F4202A4C658F75DA8FF1B.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in text; analyze word choices and the impact on meaning.

91D8E3586ED243E5A4A2C7A6802D05CE.description: RL.4: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

B105C4158F4246B9B5C3D928203E540A.description: Determine how characters change or develop over the course of a text.

1297E9B071F5430E8D87C3ACF28C0553.description: CCR Anchor Standard RL.3 –Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

6B52BD5D643F44B089A8F85C63AA7015.description: Determine which citations demonstrate what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

D666D437207642F0A1465659D273176B.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.2 –Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting
details and ideas.

2D15AE6D8D704455B027003C8636A084.description: Determine which citations demonstrate what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

96BCE653730E4E1D8329B3A4CF9BC7FD.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.1 – Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific
textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.
